description: A cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryWarningNotification is sent if
the current time is greater than or equal to (the expiry time
minus the initial warning interval), but less than the expiry
time. They are sent at configured intervals.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryWarningTrapState needs to be set to enabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryWarningNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 6 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertType i 1 CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertValidTo s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the type of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertType

description: This object indicates the name of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName

description: This object indicates the validTo date of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertValidTo

description: A cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryExpiredNotification is sent if
the current time is greater than or equal to the expiry time.
They are sent at configured intervals.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryExpiredTrapState needs to be set to enabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertExpiryExpiredNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 3 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertType i 1 CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertValidTo s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the type of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertType

description: This object indicates the name of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName

description: This object indicates the validTo date of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertValidTo

description: A cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInstallNotification is sent if
a CA certificate has been successfully installed.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInstallTrapState needs to be set to enabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInstallNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 8 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlType s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertCrlOperation s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the type of object, CA or CRL.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlType

description: This object indicates the name of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName

description: This object indicates the type of operation on the cert or CRL.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertCrlOperation

description: A cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInvalidCaNotification is sent if
during an attempted installation, the CA certificate
is found to be invalid.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInvalidCaTrapState needs to be set to enabled.

event.Summary: CA certificate is invalid due to $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInvalidCaNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 4 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInvalidCaReason s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the reason the CA is invalid.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCaCrlInvalidCaReason

description: A cienaCesSecurityDevCertInstallNotification is sent if
a device certificate has been successfully installed or uninstalled.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityDevCertInstallTrapState needs to be set to enabled.

event.Summary: Install state of device certificate $v3 successfully changed ($v4)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityDevCertInstallNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 8 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertCrlOperation s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the name of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName

description: This object indicates the type of operation on the cert or CRL.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertCrlOperation

description: A cienaCesSecurityDevCertKeyCreateNotification is sent if
a device certificate key has been successfully created.
To enable the device to send this trap:
cienaCesSecurityDevCertKeyCreateTrapState needs to be set to enabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityDevCertKeyCreateNotification CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 2 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName s EXAMPLE CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertKeyOperation s EXAMPLE

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the name of the certificate.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertName

description: This object indicates the type of operation on the cert key.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-SECURITY-MIB::cienaCesSecurityCertKeyOperation
